comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: The parade was for the unveiling of the Fireman's memorial on the site at 100th Street and Riverside Drive, and on Sept. 5, 1913, 10,000 people assembled for the unveiling. Four girls -- Margaret Dow, 10, May Boyne, 12, Florence Walsh, 11, and Mary Connolly, 10 -- took down two large United States flags that covered the monument. All four were daughters of firemen killed in the line of duty.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The unveiling of the memorial was a national event, which attracted delegations of visiting firemen from all over the U.S.
